cards.name: Surge
cards.text:
Play only if you placed at least 1 virus counter on a program this turn.
Place 2 virus counters on that program.
cards.flavor: You must yell "surge" to get the full effect.

cards.name: Xanadu
cards.text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
cards.flavor: And all should cry, Beware! Beware! His flashing eyes, his floating hair! Weave a circle round him thrice, And close your eyes with holy dread. For he on honey-dew hath fed. And drunk the milk of Paradise. -Samuel Taylor Coleridge

cards.name: Andromeda: Dispossessed Ristie
cards.text: You draw a starting hand of 9 cards.

cards.name: Networking
cards.text: Remove 1 tag. You may pay 1[Credit] to add Networking to your grip instead of trashing it.
cards.flavor: She preferred to do business in a club. Something about the lights and dancers clouded the judgment of the corporate simpletons she met there.

cards.name: HQ Interface
cards.text: Whever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
cards.flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.

cards.name: Pheremones
cards.text:
X[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheremones. Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheremones.

cards.name: Quality Time
cards.text: Draw 5 cards.
cards.flavor: She at her PAD. I at my rig. Low lights. Smooth jazz. Love blooms.

cards.name: Replicator
cards.text: Whenever you install a piece of hardware (including Replicator), you may search your stack for another copy of that hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.

cards.name: Creeper
cards.text: If you have at least 2[Link], the memory cost of Creeper is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[Credits]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[Credit]: +1 strength.
cards.flavor: "The itsy bitsy spider went up the data spout..." -Chaos Theory

cards.name: Kraken
cards.text:
Play only if you stole an agenda this turn.
Choose a server. The Corp trashes 1 piece of ice protecting that server.
cards.flavor: Early permutations of the kraken proved to be insatiable, ice-devouring marauders. Not much has changed.

cards.name: Kati Jones
cards.text: You cannot use Kati Jones more than once per turn. [Click]: Place 3[Credits] from the bank on Kati Jones. [Click]: Take all credits from Kati Jones.
cards.flavor: "You aren't the only type of runner in New Angeles."

cards.name: Eve Campaign
cards.text:
Place 16[Credits] from the bank on Eve Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Eve Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2[Credits] from Eve Campaign.

cards.name: Rework
cards.text: Shuffle 1 card from HQ into R&D.

cards.name: Whirlpool
cards.text: [Subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.

cards.name: Hokusai Grid
cards.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
cards.flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.

cards.name: Data Hound
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace2- If successful, look at a number of cards from the top of the Runner's stack equal to the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength. Trash 1 of those cards, and arrange the rest in any order.

cards.name: Bernice Mai
cards.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, trace5- if successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If unsuccessful, trash Bernice Mai.
cards.flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.

cards.name: Salvage
cards.text: Salvage can be advanced only when rezzed and gains "[Subroutine] Trace2- If successful, give the Runner 1 tag." for each advancement token on it.

cards.name: Simone Diego
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to advance cards in or protecting this server.
cards.flavor: "A job done once is a job done right."

cards.name: Foxfire
cards.text: Trace7- If successful, trash 1 virtual resource or 1 link.
cards.flavor: "It's kind of like an anagram." -designer Phoenix
